text: The 2018 Asian Track Cycling Championships took place at the Velodrom Nasional Malaysia in Nilai, Malaysia from 16 to 20 February 2017. while the Asian Road Cycling Championships were held in Naypyidaw, Myanmar from 8 February to 10 February 2018. ==Medal summary== ===Road=== ====Men==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |- |Team time trial | Yukiya Arashiro Fumiyuki Beppu Rei Onodera Masaki Yamamoto Shoi Matsuda Yusuke Hatanaka | Arvin Moazzami Samad Pourseyedi Behnam Arian Mehdi Sohrabi Mohammad Rajabloo Mohammad Esmaeil Chaichi | Cheung King Lok Fung Ka Hoo Ko Siu Wai Ho Burr Mow Ching Yin Leung Chun Wing |} ====Women==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ===Track=== ====Men==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |1 km time Jianxin |- |Team pursuit | Ryo Chikatani Shogo Ichimaru Shunsuke Imamura Keitaro Sawada | Min Kyeong-ho Im Jae-yeon Kim Ok-cheol Kang Tae-woo | Hou Yake Xue Chaohua Qin Chenlu Shen Pingan |} Kajihara | Kim You-ri Yu Seon-ha | Jin Chenhong Liu Jiali |- |Team sprint | Zhong Tianshi Song Chaorui Guo Yufang |valign=top| Lee Hye-jin Kim Won-gyeong |valign=top| Riyu Ota Kayono Maeda |- |Team pursuit | Yuya Hashimoto Kie Furuyama Yumi Kajihara Kisato Nakamura | Wang Xiaofei Liu Juali Wang Hong Ma Menglu | Yu Seon-ha Lee Ju-mi Kim You-ri Kim Hyun-ji |} ==Medal table== ==Records== Asian records were set in the following track events: * Men's individual pursuit (qualifying round): 4:22.899 by Min Kyeong-ho * Men's team pursuit (gold medal final): 3:57.801 by Japan (Ryo Chikatani, Shogo Ichimaru, Shunsuke Imamura and Keitaro Sawada) * Women's individual pursuit (qualifying round): 3:34.198 by Lee Ju-mi * Women's team pursuit (gold medal final): 4:22.138 by Japan (Yuya Hashimoto, Kie Furuyama, Yumi Kajihara and Kisato Nakamura) ==References== ==External links== *Asian Cycling Federation *Road results *Track results *Road Results book *Track Results book title: 2018 Asian Cycling Championships
